main event: An observer reported sighting a round, glowing object in the sky over London, Ohio, on March 1, 1966, for approximately three minutes.
interesting points: The object maneuvered at a high rate of speed and appeared to accelerate rapidly., The observer estimated the object to be about 35 feet across with concentric bands., The object made no sound and was described as disc-shaped., The sighting occurred under clear weather conditions., The observer experienced a temporary loss of consciousness during the observation.
witness description: A 49-year-old male, retired civil servant with a background in optics.
